item.title: Remerge all sites back to moparisthebest.com
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

This has been a massively discussed topic. We have spent many hours going over what to do about this idea. The consensus between what we came up with and what the rest of the administration decided is before your eyes on the board index. There are more infrastructure changes planned besides what was implemented with the boards, so expect a few more possible changes.

As to a full merge, that has been decided against and will not happen. Moparisthebest and MoparScape are simply considered separate communities in every way possible, minus the shared accounts. That is how it will be for now on. If you want private server development, you go here. If you want RuneScape hacking, you go to Moparisthebest.com.

This topic is resolved.

item.title: Remerge all sites back to moparisthebest.com
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:274, topic:445369”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=548068.msg4044336#msg4044336 date=1341952500]

If it was going to happen it should of by now, but lets not jump the gun.

It takes a long time to add a [spoiler] tag. I’d say if it does happen it would be during christmas.

Has MITB responded?
[/quote]

Every modification done to this forum has significant implementation time. Moparisthebest must setup a temporary forum with the same configurations as this forum, install the custom mod (either through the installer or, more likely, by hand) and then test everything to make sure nothing broke. After that he must put the live forum into maintenance mode, install the modification, and bring it back. That involves a lot of downtime for users that don’t even care about a spoiler tag, besides it requires a ton of Mopar’s time.

Because of this, we batch together features that are requested for several months and try to install them all in one go. Most of the changes I want to do have to wait until a lot of those mods are made and installed. We’re not waiting on one thing, other than me having the time and motivation to build the mods we need. Beyond that, we go through a very long installation phase and then finally get to see changes.[/quote]

I realize that. I wasn’t trying to hurt anyone’s feelings. I was giving him an idea of how long a move of this magnitude can take.

item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

The Wanderer:

Ive noticed more mitb members on this side of the forum, so i’m guessing the only thing needing worked out is the organization and permissions? People seem like they want it to happen.

I could pull a jagex and say that the number of people that post in this section and, in this exact topic, relative to the number of active and partially active users and guests in this community is rather small. In fact, so small that it’s almost not worth considering the opinions of this topic. To be even more of an asshole, there is no concise decision agreed upon in this topic. Disregarding staff posts, the users have been arguing quite a bit about what the best course of action is and no one seems to really know.

Now not being an asshole, given that this is such a massive change with little benefits, we are looking into better solutions (such as cookie sharing, board redirections, and board/category sharing). We have specific goals for each part of this community and these ideas luckily coincide with those goals well.

[quote=“m1lkman, post:272, topic:445369”][quote author=TabbyKiller link=topic=548068.msg4043994#msg4043994 date=1341915790]
If it was going to happen it should of by now, but lets not jump the gun.
[/quote]

It takes a long time to add a [spoiler] tag. I’d say if it does happen it would be during christmas.

Has MITB responded?[/quote]

Every modification done to this forum has significant implementation time. Moparisthebest must setup a temporary forum with the same configurations as this forum, install the custom mod (either through the installer or, more likely, by hand) and then test everything to make sure nothing broke. After that he must put the live forum into maintenance mode, install the modification, and bring it back. That involves a lot of downtime for users that don’t even care about a spoiler tag, besides it requires a ton of Mopar’s time.

Because of this, we batch together features that are requested for several months and try to install them all in one go. Most of the changes I want to do have to wait until a lot of those mods are made and installed. We’re not waiting on one thing, other than me having the time and motivation to build the mods we need. Beyond that, we go through a very long installation phase and then finally get to see changes.

item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

To be fair, elve age was correct in locking the topic. There have been many threads about religion, and while his reasoning was wrong (the potential for an argument to break out is not a reason to lock a topic), it would have been better to just link to an older topic/merge the topics and have it continue there. If the same topic would have been made on MITB, I think I can say with a bit of certainty it would have been locked as well. There are many topics discussing religion there, and this one would have just been spammed, taken off topic, and then locked anyways.

Also, MITB has an actual discussions & debates section, so in this example you cannot compare the two. I personally think MPSC should have a D&D board as well, so that people can argue (civilly, mind you) without fear of being infracted for it.
